title: How bad is...
body:
Ekko going to get nerfed?
I mean seriously!
His Q is broken, the dash is too far, the ult idm.
I'm just wondering if people will play him if gets nerfed badly

replies.body:
44% win rate in Plat + with a 46% win rate overall.

Has many easy counters.

And every one of his ability's, you can really easily counterplay.

I really hope that Riot realize that he isn't as OP as everyone want's to complain he is and don't actually nerf him.

You cannot use win-rate, he was just released so nobody knows his potential yet, win-rate means nothing at a champs release.

Don't care about the rest of your comment, just wanted to point this one thing out.

nobody knows his potential, may be true. 
nobody also knows how to play against him and instantly want nerfs. just stfu he isnt OP and is easily playable against get gud

Never in my comment did i say he is "OP", don't tell me to shut the fuck up, ill say whatever i want because i am free to express my opinions, it is you who needs to shut the fuck up because you have nothing constructive to say but stupid remarks such as "stfu" and "git gud", you don't know if the champion is overpowered yet nor does anybody else so stop acting like you do know, he could very well be broken, we don't know till people have learnt how to play him.

Nobody knows his potential, and also no-one knows how to counter-play (read like half the board's topics.) so they realistically cancel each other out.

And just because a champ has potential doesn't mean that they are going to get an increased win rate, as this applys to champions like lee sin, sure his kit is amazing, but it's not going to increase his win rate ever because everyone and their dog plays him without being able to tap that potential.

It doesn't cancel itself out, you must wait a bit before you can even think about calling him overpowered or underpowered.

Did i say that? No i did not, he has the potential to be overpowered, underpowered, really easy and really hard, i did not specify what particular potential he has so don't just assume, he can be anything, i merely said that you cannot judge him yet because he was just released.

His Q isnt broken.

The only change i can see him getting is a mana cost for his ulti.

imo hes fine atm

The only thing that is broken is whenever an Ekko is on my team they end up feeding then the other Team Ekko he ends up wrecking my Ekko. 
DON'T PLAY HIM BECAUSE YOU WILL SUCK WITH HIM AND RUIN THE FUN FOR THE REST OF THE TEAM.

how bad is.

He's not that bad.
He a bit too strong on his fighter capability with the shields and stuns.
I reckon Riot can turn him into an effective secondary role support if they tweak the scalings a little bit. A bit like how {{champion:150}} was an effective support because of his CC.

his e is the only real balaned part of his kit IMO, his q needs a reduced slow, his passive needs a reduced slow duration, he doesn't need %hp damage on his w (should be flat), Ult needs a mana cost or a damage reduction.

I would say increase the % damage (not the 30% threshold) but reduce his other abilities' damage by a bit.
And I totally agree on a small nerf to his passive movement speed boost and slow.

I don't think hes broken. Only you guys have not got used to counter play his kit or actually played him yourselves. If you look at lolskill.net you will see across the boards Ekko's win rate is ONLY 47% compared to others champs. I think there is about 40+ champs that have over 50% win rate ratio. You should be looking at those numbers
how can you call a 3 second 80% slow not broken?
It's a skill shot, can be dodged.

That's a passive, it isn't a skillshot his passive is 80% slow for 3 seconds at last rank lol. 
His Q is 60% at max rank.
During late game
He has 80% slow, a 60% slow and a 40% slow. If he still can't get away he has his E to dash away through walls quite effectively. if they manage to catch him over the walls he ults and escapes.

I'm not saying he's OP. But his passive needs a small nerf as does his early game  (lane phase) combo damage by 5-10%. He's okay to deal with during mid and late. His lane phase is painful to play against to say the least.

Basically to deal with him most effectively you need to play range champions that preferably have a good set of CC kit.

He is broken but not as much as everyone says, the slow is a little much but idm bcz i ban him 24/7

W needs nerf, im talking shield. If he stuns one guy he can wipe half your team behind the safety of the "no one shot I pop" shield while what's his face is stuck doing nothing.

The e is a dash AND a blink. should at least be a delay between available use of both (like zed nerf)

Ult shouldn't be a fucking nuke

q should stack in a weaker slow rather then just flat 80% both ways.

Maybe timer on ult to give people a window to burst him down?????

Definitely improve something statistically otherwise no one will play him higher elo for the ban rate and people will use him to boost in bronze and silver (aka fiora stomper que)

He really isn't OP, he's just too strong.

I believe they will reduce the duration of his 2.25 seconds at all levels stun down to 1.75.
His passive needs a nerf in his movement speed boost, it's basically a mini-Jinx passive every few seconds. 

Right now Ekko's most powerful phase is during the lane phase. It's close to an impossibility to stop him from harassing with huge burst with his passive.

In saying all these, range champions make it harder for Ekko to CS properly. They can counter harass his combo.

I have tried to explain to people that the Q is like Ahri's but people still stand in it.

If you add both the first and second hit together you notice low damage but high scaling.

W, easily the most overloaded ability on any champion that stuns for a ridiculous 2.25 seconds if he stands in it when it blows while giving him a shield. And then there is the passive component that makes up a large amount of his damage. He won't be able to get many autos off in that stun time though.

The E dash and jump ranges are fine, if someone can stick to you using it won't save you.

R, extremely fun panic button. Some may say being able to deal over 1000 points of damage is nuts but it makes you think about when you should use this.

Riot will have to give it another week before they decide to do anything too major. TBH I think they might be deliberately be just slightly making new champions too strong statwise so people can play them.
Bard was the newest champ before Ekko. He has been buffed a few times.
Because he was weak, he needed a few tweaks to make him what he is today which is a great support.
Squishy will forever = bad in the eyes of some people. His hype died down heaps so I guess he could do with some buffs to make hihm more appealing.
